title: ChatGPT maker OpenAI announces customizable chatbots and enhanced AI models
description: The San Francisco-based start-up presented its latest innovations on Monday while promising 'superpowers on demand' for all.

title: Island of El Hierro: A new migrant route to Spain in the Canary Islands
description: In October alone, over 13,000 migrants landed in the Spanish archipelago, with nearly 7,300 of them arriving on its smallest territory, which is trying to avoid the 'Lampedusa effect,' a term coined after the Italian island overwhelmed by migrant arrivals.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The United States comes under fresh criticism from Arab countries
description: In the Middle East, US diplomatic chief Antony Blinken attempts to give a renewed role to the Palestinian Authority.

title: Elon Musk's biography, an (anti)education manual
description: As part of a series exploring parenting abroad, Le Monde looks at how the American billionaire and Tesla founder is leaning on his own version of the Montessori method of education to raise his 11 children.

title: London climate protestors smash glass protecting Velazquez's Venus
description: Two activists from direct-action group Just Stop Oil broke the glass protecting 'The Rokeby Venus,' chosen because it was previously slashed in 1914 as part of the suffragette movement.

title: Macron backs French Youtuber's video game museum project
description: In a video published on Sunday, the French president said he was giving his support to the Tev project, from the Twitch channel IciJaponCorp. The online crowdfunding campaign has already raised over €1.7 million.

title: Trump takes the stand in New York civil fraud trial
description: The former US president testified in a Manhattan court on Monday, attempting to persuade the judge that he did not inflate his net worth to defraud banks and insurers.

title: Bezalel Smotrich, Israel's agent of chaos
description: The fundamentalist minister, who advocates all-out war in both Gaza and the West Bank, is trying to put pressure on Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Strike at Centre Pompidou reveals deep-seated anxiety among staff
description: Personnel are worried about what will happen to them during the museum's closure, scheduled for 2025 to 2030. They fear the use of outsourced providers and are calling to be redeployed at a single location.

title: Europe's space industry searches for a way out of its crisis
description: The 22 member states of the European Space Agency are meeting in Seville on Monday, in an attempt to find a compromise between the German and French positions and to secure the funding operation of Ariane-6.

title: Israeli therapists take on healing a traumatized population
description: The Hamas massacre in the Jewish state on October 7 deeply shocked all Israelis. Across the country, psychologists and psychiatrists have been working both directly and indirectly to help the victims.

title: France's Sénat starts debating contested immigration bill
description: The government's text needs the support of conservative MPs to get through both houses of Parliament.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Footage of the Al-Maghazi refugee camp after bombing that killed dozens
description: At least 45 people were killed in air strikes on the Al-Maghazi refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip, said the Hamas-run health ministry.

title: Zelensky's trip to Israel in doubt after media leak
description: The Ukrainian president, who has adopted a pro-Israeli stance, has been trying to rally Israel to his cause since Russia first invaded his country.

title: Between Israel and Palestine, Japan practises a discreet balancing act
description: Since Hamas attacked Israel on October 7, Tokyo has been cautious. Most often aligned with American positions in this part of the world, it has shied away from US demands by conducting equidistant diplomacy between Arab countries and Israel for half a century.

title: Israeli army intensifies strikes on Gaza, plunging civilians into horror and hunger
description: The enclave has been cut in two by the Israeli military, as the population of the north has been forced to flee to the south. Eighteen UN agencies are calling for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire.

title: French justice minister's trial for conflicts of interest opens
description: Eric Dupond-Moretti is accused of having used his position to launch investigations into magistrates with whom he had run-ins as a lawyer. He will be judged by a special jurisdiction for members of government.

title: Scientific journal impacted by Israel-Hamas war
description: The editor-in-chief of 'eLife' magazine, Michael Eisen, was fired after a controversial tweet about the Israel-Hamas war, provoking a debate about freedom of speech.

title: Visiting Kyiv, EU's von der Leyen gives Ukraine a much-needed boost
description: While the war between Israel and Hamas is monopolizing the world's attention, the European Commission president said on Saturday that the country had made 'excellent progress' in the reforms deemed necessary before opening possible negotiations for EU membership.

title: 2024 European elections: A possible 'rural' campaign could shift lines of French right and far right
description: A lobbyist advising the National Hunter's Federation is working on a list to defend 'rural values' in the European elections – with tacit support from President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Planting a billion trees in 10 years: Macron's risky promise for French forests
description: The French president's commitment is worrying specialists, who believe that it focuses solely on numbers, at the expense of protecting biodiversity.

title: Earthquake-prone Nepal hit by another temblor
description: Friday's 5.6 magnitude earthquake in western Nepal killed at least 157 people. The country's National Seismic Monitoring and Research Centre has recorded more than 70 quakes with a magnitude greater than 4 since the beginning of the year.

title: Chile's newest Constitution draft enters its home stretch
description: On Tuesday, November 7, 2023, left-wing president Gabriel Boric will receive a proposal for a new text that has been prepared over eight months by experts and elected advisors. Polls indicate its possible rejection in a referendum on December 17.
